prompt: Convert calculator.js to TypeScript with proper types, JSDoc comments, and error handling for division by zero

steps.title: Rename calculator.js to calculator.ts
steps.rationale: Convert JavaScript file to TypeScript by changing the file extension

patches.explanation: Remove the original JavaScript file as part of the conversion to TypeScript
Created TypeScript version of calculator with proper types, JSDoc comments, and division by zero error handling

steps.title: Add TypeScript types and interfaces
steps.rationale: Define proper types for function parameters, return values, and any objects used in the calculator

patches.explanation: Converted calculator to TypeScript with proper types: defined CalculatorResult interface for operation results, CalculatorOperation type for supported operations, added comprehensive JSDoc comments for all methods, implemented error handling for division by zero using result objects instead of exceptions, and added a generic calculate method for safe operation execution.

steps.title: Add JSDoc comments to all functions
steps.rationale: Document all calculator functions with JSDoc comments describing parameters, return values, and behavior

patches.explanation: Added comprehensive JSDoc comments to all functions including parameter descriptions, return value documentation, usage examples, and error handling documentation for the divide function. The comments follow JSDoc standards with @param, @returns, @throws, and @example tags.

steps.title: Implement division by zero error handling
steps.rationale: Add proper error handling for division operations to prevent division by zero and provide meaningful error messages
